ygData.subject: Re: Discussion: Closing the Archives

I'm generally in favor of leaving the archives open, but it matters
how you=
're using the list.  If you leave it open the list roster would
have folks =
who want to talk.  If it's closed the roster shows those
who want to talk a=
nd are curious about the archives.  I like the
former because it's more foc=
used.

We could have two groups, along the lines of neat-dev and
neat-discu=
ss.  I have ideas I'd like to toss around regarding adapting
NEAT to rules =
and inference engines, but they're not really at the
nitty gritty algorithm=
 stage yet.  I've never been sure if I should
just blather on about them be=
cause the discussion here mostly seemed
to be of a nitty gritty algorithm n=
ature.  

So, maybe a binary choice isn't necessary.  Just fork it!

neat-d=
ev: closed archives, serious nuts 'n' bolts discussion of
implementations
n=
eat-discuss: open archives, potentially fluffy discussion of anything
relat=
ed to NEAT

You could also have an automated monthly message (and on signup=
) to
neat-discuss that says, "If you want to talk about coding NEAT, head
o=
ver to neat-dev..."

GreG
